ASV portal
asvoccur

Hands-on tutorial: Import and analyse ASV portal data with R (55 min)

Explore biodiversity patterns across environments in R

Wrap-up (5 min)

Key takeaways
Getting help after the workshop

title: Hands-on tutorial
text: This tutorial walks through the main steps needed to integrate ASV portal data in R and explore biodiversity patterns. As an example, we analyse microbial diversity along the Baltic Sea salinity gradient.

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text: Welcome to the Exploring eDNA in SBDI workshop at SBDI Days 2026!

title: Get started
text:
Goal
Access the workshop RStudio environment and verify that you can run R code.

title: Get started
text:
Workshop environment
For this workshop, you will work in a pre-configured RStudio environment accessed via a web browser. No local installation is required.

title: Get started
text:
Steps

1. Log in

Open the workshop login link (provided by the facilitators).
Sign in using your assigned username and password.



2. Check that R is running
In the Console tab in RStudio, run:
```r sessionInfo()

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Description
This workshop will demonstrate how environmental DNA (eDNA) / metabarcoding data can be accessed, processed, and analyzed within the Swedish Biodiversity Data Infrastructure (SBDI). We will show how to download eDNA data, use our R package to unpack, merge, and aggregate datasets, and then explore biodiversity patterns across environments in R. The session will also introduce SBDI resources for data submission, processing, and integration with GBIF.

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Expected outcomes
Participants will learn about tools and workflows for eDNA data management and analysis, and how these contribute to open biodiversity knowledge.

title: Exploring eDNA in SBDI
text:
Instructors

Prof. Anders Andersson — SBDI & KTH SciLifeLab
Dr. Daniel Lundin — SBDI & Linnaeus University
Dr. Maria Prager — SBDI & University of Gothenburg
